bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Helen Wheeler, March 21, 1941

div1.p: Hench will be in Florida and Havana for several weeks. He informs Wheeler that he will leave the yellow fever data from her library in his office.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Helen Wheeler, March 21, 1941
div1.opener:
March 21, 1941
Miss Helen Wheeler
Welch Medical Library
1900 East Monument Street
Baltimore, Maryland
My dear Miss Wheeler:
div1.p:
I will be in Florida and Havana for five
weeks. Therefore, I am doing as you suggest and
will put the yellow fever data from your library
in my office at the Clinic. In case you need it,
write to my secretary, Miss Fern Peterson, Mayo
Clinic and she will send it to you. But I hope
I may have it just a few weeks more and then I
will return it all safe and sound.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:FP
Miss Helen Wheeler
Welch Medical Library
The Johns Hopkins University
1900 E. Monument Street
Baltimore, Md.
P. S. Dr. Hench left for meetings in the East
so hurriedly that he did not have time to send the material
that he mentioned to you. When he returns, he will return
all of it to you.
Secretary
